results.title: Eulogy For A Black Mass

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: Aria Dean explores the black creative labour put into memes, images defined not by their content but by how they are circulated, mutated and compressed - International Film Festival Rotterdam
description_for_label: Aria Dean explores the black creative labour put into memes, images defined not by their content but by how they are circulated, mutated and compressed - International Film Festival Rotterdam

results.title: Eugene Onegin
results.brief_description: The rustic charm and palatial splendour of Tsarist Russia is the background for Pushkin’s hauntingly romantic drama “Eugene Onegin”, set to Tchaikovsky’s beautiful score. This live recording from Chicago’s Lyric Opera boasts an internationally renowned cast led by Mirella Freni as Tatania and Wolfgang Brendel in the challenging role. Rated: G

results.title: Eudyptula Minor (Fairy Penguins)
results.creator_credit: Comalco, Art Mayer and Graham Pizzey
results.brief_description: Inhabiting the milder waters of southern Australia and New Zealand, the Fairy Penguin does not grow to the height of its companions in the Antarctic regions; it stands about 16 inches tall. This film shot at Summerlands Beach, a protected nesting ground on Phillip Island, follows the penguins through their daily routine, beginning with their return from the sea at dusk after fishing.

results.title: Etoiles 4: Jeunes Francophones
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Susan Paton and Luis Espana
results.brief_description: Filmed in Toulouse (France), Montreal (Canada) and Dakar (Senegal), the programmes focus on the variety of the French-speaking world. It focuses on aspects of life and concerns common to teenagers all around the world. Colourful and set to a heady rap theme, ‘Jeunes Francophones’ is filmed in magazine style and presented by three teen reporters, Isabelle, Cecile and Boss M.C. The series comprises 10 episodes of 19 minutes and is intended to be used by Years 10 and 11 students. The episode titles describe the theme of each episode: ‘Trois Continents’, ‘Le Look’, ‘Le Sport’, ‘Temps Libre’, ‘Notre environement’, ‘Le travail’, ‘Les medias’, ‘Je t’aime’, ‘La bonne assiette’, ‘Notre planete’. Includes a study guide with full transcripts and activities.

results.title: Etoiles 3: Le Cafe des reves
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Susan Paton and Roger Tonge
results.brief_description: Third instalment of the ‘Etoiles’ language series, ‘Le Cafe des Reves’ is a five-part drama, similar in style to ‘Home and Away’ or ‘Neighbours’. Adapted from the book by Nigel Hinton, ‘Le Cafe des Reves’ follows a group a teenagers trying to revive a small cafe in the Northern town of Lille. The cafe is owned by Madame Lambin who is also the guardian of Serge, her 15 year old grand son, whose father is working abroad. The clients are a mix of old neighborhood residents and Serge’s friends. When Madame Lambin falls prey to a bag snatcher and is taken to hospital, Serge and his friends attempt to take over the reins of the business and renovate it in order to attract the clientele of the local high school. The programme is as much a language course as an insight into French life, none the less important being its multi-racial make-up. ‘Le Cafe des Reves’ introduces the viewers to issues of family relationships, peer group behaviour and respect of authority. The programme is recommended for students aged 13 to 15. Includes a study guide with full transcripts and class activities.

results.title: Etoiles 2: Ici Paris
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Sensible Films and Luis Espana
results.brief_description: This second instalment of the ‘Etoiles’ series uses a pacy magazine style to take the viewer around Paris and its most original and quirky aspects. Far from concentrating on the usual monuments and landmarks, this series attach itself to the lifestyles of 12-14 year old people living in Paris, the variety of their experiences and ethnic background. The programme is intended to be used by second year French students and above. It contains 5 episodes on 13 minutes each (approx.) Includes guide with transcripts of each episode and additional activities.

results.title: Ethiopian mosaic
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Hugh O'Connor
results.brief_description: An engrossing blend of scenes in the ancient kingdom of Ethiopia where indolent camels still sway through the sand and long-robed tribesmen race their Arabian steeds, while great airliners glide into a modern airport. Produced without commentary, this film seems to put the viewer in the midst of the crowds of smiling people, among whom is glimpsed the emperor himself, Haile Selassie, Lion of Judah.

results.title: Ethiopia advances
results.brief_description: An account of the work of the Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations in helping Ethiopia make best use of her fertile land. FAO experts’ recommendations included the use of labour saving farm implements; importation of new seeds to improve local crop; the setting up of an experimental seed growing station; the vaccination of Zebu cattle against Rinderpest.

results.title: Ethics in the computer age
results.brief_description: Examines the loss of revenue suffered by the designers and producers of computer software caused by the pirating of video games. The focus is on the theft of “intellectual property” by people using computers in their homes. It also explains the dangers of hackers accessing sensitive information and the potentially life-endangering results of tampering with that information.
